channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytipping - Washing machine, 13th February
item.description:
A washing machine has been left in the street by flytippers, it is also an obstruction.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Thames Street, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The street drain is obviously blocked, 13th February
item.description:
As of heavy rain yesterday the drain is overflowing at one point the water was across to other side of rd and entering my drive way this took several hours to clear . But once again after rain this morning we are in the same position , at the moment it’s still quite deep . The drain itself is outside my neighbours house no 8 elmwood drive , I did notice that when the drain cleaner was going along pumping out the drains last time this one was missed . Would appreciate if this could be sorted before we get in the position of more heavy rain & flooding our properties Await your reply .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Elmwood Drive, Albany Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pile of fly tipping, 13th February
item.description:
This pile of waste has been building up for at least a week.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-12, Barton Close, Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge pothole. Pavement flooded in many places, drains blocked, no leaf clearing for months. A decent area is turining into a dump., 13th February
item.description:
My road, Eaglesfield, and many streets and roads around me, are turning into dumps. Council couldn't give a hoot. How about we stop paying exorbitant council tax .

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Eaglesfield Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Emergency Access blocked, 13th February
item.description:
Someone has installed 2 padlocks to the access gates so residents or emergency services are unable to access the rear of 10 properties on Fletching Road. RBGreenwich say they did not put them there but they need to go as in the event of fire no one will be able to get out. Neither me nor immediate neighbours have suitable tools to remove them.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Fletching Road, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Raised and cracked paving slabs, 13th February
item.description:
Obviously, there has been a vehicle delivering something, or parked on the pavement as there is quite a lot of wet sand in the area. Was not there at the beginning of the week when I walked to the station.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Monkton Road, East Wickham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: I have lolived in radnor avenue for 10 years, every year it is flooded whenever it rains -its about time a repair was done ,on several occasions flood water has entered my property , it is also dangerous for pedestrians avoided the flood, 13th February
item.description:
The flooding radnor avenue grts whenever it rains is very inconvenient and dangerous, there is an accident waiting to happen -or several houses will be flooded as well ,i have been a resident here for 10 years -it floods every year and before i loved here

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Radnor Avenue, Blackfen, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bright LED street light into bedrooms, 13th February
item.description:
I know that #20 Lord Holland Lane has previously reported this issue. So trying again to get it fixed. Lamp post on Burton Lane, at back of 20/21 Lord Holland Lane houses. Newer LED lamppost lights are extremely bright into the bedroom windows of number 20 / 21 Lord Holland Lane. Could they be dimmed or have a back cover put on the lamp? Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evandale Road, Loughborough Junction, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Construction works blocking road, 13th February
item.description:
Construction works on Pomeroy Street mean traffic can’t get through - it’s backed up in both directions for hours a day. The builders need to install temporary traffic lights as the traffic is unable to get past. This has been going on for a couple of weeks now.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coll's Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fleming Road needs a good sweep across the width., 13th February
item.description:
I accept parked cars prevent the proper cleaning of the gutters (which of course affects water flow in all this rain) but there is all sorts of debris in the road, particularly after bin collection when stuff gets dropped and left. I have seen stuff that has been there weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fleming Road, Elephant and Castle, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked Drain At End Of Rokesby Close, 13th February
item.description:
Ref: 8905824 This problem has not been fixed, it has rained again and the drain has overflowed. There is a blockage due to material lodged in the drain that has been there for months. The drain needs pumping out so please action.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rokesby Close, Falconwood, Greater London

item.title: Mud, leaves and rain on the kerb and pavement, 13th February
item.description:
The rain and the leaves have caused so much dirt. This has not been cleaned for some time. The result is that this wet and soggy dirt is being transferred into our cars and on the cars. Not nice at all. There are also some broken bricks on the pavement as well. Please kindly clean these . This has been reported. The updates show that the dirt has been cleaned but that is not the case.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolwich Road, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
